name: Tammy
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
October 2022
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: This beautiful home was by far the BEST vacation home I've stayed in! From the moment I pulled into the driveway I knew this place was special! It may seen like a small thing, but what first impressed me was the large "turn-around" area in the back of the home which allowed for turning my car around and leaving the driveway "head-first" instead of backing out on a main road. (This has been an issue for me in many vacation homes I've stayed at.) When I walked through the back door I was met with a huge country kitchen! The large island had cookies and pies waiting along with a sweet note from the owner. The cabinets and drawers were stocked with any dish/utensil you could possibly need. There were water bottles in the refrigerator and quarts of Blue Bell ice cream in the freezer! The large dining table could fit a family of six easily! A cozy couch and love seat were in the living room, and was a perfect "winding-down" area after a long day at Round Top! The two bedrooms were large and the beds were very comfortable. The master bath had a huge shower, double sinks and ample towels and washcloths (which were amazingly soft). The second bathroom was only steps away from the second bedroom. It, too, was roomy and had more than enough towels. The owner, Sharon, was very friendly, easy to reach and so accommodating! This home definitely exceeded my expectations! I was a bit sad to leave and I will definitely be back!

name: Steve
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
July 2023
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: If you are looking for a place away from the bustle of the city and where you can enjoy peace and quiet, with a magnificent pool, this is it! The barndominium is outside the city of Brenham in rolling hills; there are neighbors (most in very posh homes) but they are far enough away where you have a sense of being in a secluded area. The lap pool is about 75-80 feet long, and perhaps the most well-constructed pool I have ever seen (the workmanship is really good). The screened porch is fully shaded in the morning and with a nice breeze it was very comfortable, even in 102 degree heat. It is less than 10 minutes to an HEB, Super Walmart, excellent restaurants. We drove one day to Round Top (15 minutes) to shop around and eat at Royer's (and took the renowned pecan pie back). The place sleeps seven easily, and with three full bathrooms, there is plenty of room. The house is spotless and well maintained. We will be coming back!

,
Â·
Stayed with kids
review_text:
The hosts of this property have thought of it all! The kitchen was fully stocked. There were lifejackets for little ones and big ones - plus Floaties and pool noodles. There were duplo blocks and train tracks for my granddaughter to play with. Everything was labeled clearly, including the light switches, which I truly appreciated! The bedrooms are spacious and who could pass up 3 full bathrooms while traveling with family?!? The back patio, fire pit and the grill make for a wonderful evening out of doors. The real bonus for me was the amount of wildlife on the property. We identified close to 50 species of birds! The wildflower meadows were full of beautiful Texas natives like Texas thistle, brown-eyed Susans, Indian blanket, and Rose-Gentians plus so many more. We also did some stargazing the first night and found both Venus and Mars plus several constellations.
If you are looking for some R&R and fresh air in a beautiful setting - do not hesitate to book the Cardinal Cottage!

Hereâ€™s what we loved:
1. This property offers the best of both worlds - it is off the beaten path but also close enough to civilization that you can run out for groceries or necessities. It felt like a true get-away from the hustle and bustle.
2. Marisol is a fantastic host! Sheâ€™s responsive and helpful.
3. The pool is the star of the show. Itâ€™s where we spent most of our time.
A few important notes when planning your trip:
1. The pool has a small splash pad that opens up to the main pool, and the depth of the main pool begins at 4.5â€™ then very quickly drops to 6â€™ and 9â€™. Youâ€™ll need to bring pool floats, even for adults, if you want to lounge in the main pool without treading water.
2. The living space in the house is small, so plan to spend most of your time outdoors.
3. TV service was spotty, so plan accordingly if, for instance, thereâ€™s a sports game you want to watch.
4. The kitchen has olive oil, salt, and pepper. Youâ€™ll need to bring any other spices or condiments with you.

review_text: Myself and a group of friends came to have a weekend getaway from Houston. I had stayed previously at the Craftsman Cottage and really loved it, so definitely wanted to book again. We all loved how nicely the home was set-up with conveniences such as charging stations, lovely snacks and wine (and Blue Bell Ice Cream!), super comfy beds, bathroom amenities and everything you could want. There are 3 spacious bedrooms--2 with really comfy kinds and one with two comfy twins, and two bathrooms. Five friends (could have fit 6 just fine) and a doggie stayed and all felt very comfy. Well appointed kitchen with counter space to prepare. We made a meal on our first night and had everything we needed to cook. Susan is an awesome host -- super communicative, quick to respond, accommodating and kind. Best air bnb experience I've had and I've had a pretty good amount. Also, lovely neighborhood, backyard, walkable to downtown (.7 miles). Will stay again for sure and recommend to the highest degree.

review_text: Our group of 3 adults and 1 tiny doggie loved our stay at Susan's place. We were in town for the Round Top extravaganza, and the house was very convenient for that purpose (about 20 minute drive to Burton). The house was very clean, beds were incredibly comfy (also loved the pillows and linens), and we all noticed and appreciated the "extras" that Susan had provided (candies, mints, coffee pods, wine!, razors, bath bombs, lotion, detergent, paper towels, creamer, bottled water & soda, shampoo, ice cream!) I can't think of anything that we needed or might have wanted that Susan hadn't considered. My dog and I also appreciated the small fenced yard, which even had doggie poop bags and a garbage can provided. I forgot a few things after we left, and Susan promptly notified me and sent them along at my request. Very gracious host with great communication. Thank you so much for a lovely stay!

We didn't go outside (it was February) to use the little patio, but other than that, we found every space comfortable and very livable. She has a great coffee/tea bar that is fully stocked with all kinds of teas, coffees, sweeteners, creamers, cute mugs all right there in the dining room, super easy to use and out of the way of the kitchen. The location of the house is great! Personally, I would not call it "walking distance to town", exactly because there are no sidewalks and we were always had a few stops, but some folks might walk it. The trip to Round Top is not to be missed- just 20-30 minutes away and all the activity on the square in Brenham is fun to explore. Go have fun!

My husband and I spontaneous decided to find a place to stay and did not want to book a room at a hotel. It was late like 930 at night on a Saturday. I didnâ€™t know if i would get a response, being so late, but I did! She was very kind and helpful.
When we arrived, we immediately loved it. That was before I even turned any lights got turned on. I could just tell that it was a unique beautiful place.
When we got inside, it was more than I expected. Very clever ways of decorating using fun. antiques with a modern twist. The bed was very comfortable and the soft sheets were lovely. It was everything I had hoped for and then some. It was private and romantic. And the location was awesome.
In the morning, I went outside to the yard and enjoyed all the little details and love that were put into the garden. I enjoyed it very much.
I highly recommend this place. I will definitely be coming back. ğŸ¤—

review_text:
What a perfect house for our family to stay at this weekend! We had the most wonderful time at the Basil Bungalow!
I asked our host, Kelsey, for some last-minute Brenham recommendations and she responded within minutes and encouraged us to go directly to the Blue Bell Creamery, as I had no idea that the ice cream observatory closed early. My daughters had the most wonderful time learning about how ice cream was made and trying numerous flavors. We then ended up eating a delicious lunch, shopping, and meeting friendly locals.
Check-in at the house was smooth and easy, the street was quiet and safe. The whole family enjoyed the relaxing patio porch swing. The house decor is cozy, comfortable and elegant. Kelsey had left a thoughtful surprise in fridge for my daughters. The playroom upstairs kept the children entertained with toys and books and beautiful skylights. We had a wonderful time and I would highly recommend Kelseyâ€™s place! We will be back! Thank you!

My family and I very much enjoyed staying at this location. It's always tough to find a convenient place that accommodates a big family. This location is the best option in Brenham that we have found hands down.

At the end of the day, we watched the sun peak behind the hill and light up the sky with beautiful colors, then relaxed in the pool. With the party barn, those who wanted to stay up later could have fun while others were able to get some sleep in the comfy beds.
The bar is set really high for the next family vacation ...

The house was as beautiful as it looked in the pictures, the kitchen was well-stocked and there were plenty of things to do. We had 6 adults and 1 toddler and found the layout to be ideal. The party barn was a lifesaver since it was a rainy weekend. We had several ping-pong "tournaments" and the karaoke machine provided great entertainment. Sitting in the hot tub was the perfect ending to each night and although we had to text Adrienne to have it turned on, she was always quick to respond and get it going for us. Adrienne was a great host, made us feel very welcome and was very responsive to any questions we had.

review_text:
If youâ€™re tired of renting aging BnBs furnished with donated furniture & threadbare linens, this refreshing space will earn your 5* rating. This listing satisfied all my desired qualities.
â€”clean: new & well-maintained appliances, fixtures & finishes provide a new-house feel.
â€”spacious: simple layout with the ideal amount of furniture & placement. Sleeps plenty without trying to jam in extra people or furniture.
â€”location: walking distance to everything worth visiting.
â€”easy-access: simple private keypad w/flexible check-in. well-concealed keypad & safe check-in.
â€”comfort: soft, clean linens, comfortable bed & furniture & extra amenities (dishes, soap, linens, snacks).
â€”parking: ideal private parking with multiple options.
â€”snacks: pampered us with extras â€” so many tempting snacks but so little time.
This is the type of place you hope for when you book a BNB even for a long-term stay. Thanks for sharing, Susan.

The homes are just really thoughtfully appointed with great amentias and conveniences, and Susan is an awesome host -- super communicative, quick to respond, accommodating and kind. I appreciated all of the convenient charging stations, bathroom amenities, and the snacks and wine were such a lovely and thoughtful touch! Regarding Blue Cottage: Wonderfully located walking distance (about .7 miles) from downtown, in a lovely neighborhood. The house is adorable, with all the aforementioned amenities. There's a really sizable backyard, too! Super comfy beds. Thank you!!

The house was in a quiet residential neighborhood close to the historic downtown area & was easy to find and to get to. Things were nicely updated inside. We enjoyed the mix of snacks, water, and ice cream left for us, and could easily have cooked full meals in the large kitchen (if there werenâ€™t so many great restaurants in town to choose from!) Great value, great stay, great communication, we would happily stay here again.

review_text:
House was easy to find. Neighborhood is pretty quiet with the occasional rooster and very distant train in the background.  You do hear the cars driving by but only if you don't have the TV on. 
Place:  Nice and cozy. Good size for us and our two little doggies. Backyard was good and flat for them - we just kept them on leases as the yard is not fully enclosed (as noted in their info).  Shower was great, bed comfy and good place to relax after a day out. 
Local experience: Close to the little downtown and other antiques we wanted to check out. 
Thank you for your hospitality.

If you're looking for an amazing place to stay in the Brenham area, book this Blue Cottage Retreat!
The cottage is exceptionally clean, with plenty of room and in a great location.
The bed was comfortable, kitchen was well stocked and the home is decorated with relaxing earth tones.
Its in a nice neighborhood with friendly neighbors walking their dogs that make you feel safe and welcomed.
We very much enjoyed our stay and visiting the town.
Blue Bell creamery is down the road if you want to take a tour.
You're also a few minutes from restaurants and shopping.
From the time we booked to the day we checked out Susan was amazing!
She sends out email info before your stay and immediately answered any email questions or comments we sent.
We will definitely be back!

Nice large open kitchen with great extras like a treat basket snacks and a bottle of wine. Blue Bell icecream in the freezer was a delightful surprise. Everything could need to cook meals. Comfortable leather couch with cozy throw blankets.
The beds were AH-MAZ-ING. They were like sleeping on cloud. With plenty extra blankets and pillows.
After being without heat and water due to winter storm Uri, the nice warm shower was so welcome. Great water pressure and added touch of shampoo, conditioner and body wash.
This would make great weekend get away or an extended stay for anyone.

I would wake up and and be in a magical woodland. I would swim at 6am, the birdsong, the wind chimes and the waterfall from the pool was enough relaxation to last for months. I had and Horses as my neighbours. Little doggos as our welcome guests. So so quiet you could hear a pin drop. The house was absolutely gorgeous. French/Texas country. Chic and modern. Clean and fully stocked. We even wine waiting for us. Gorgeous views of a pond with water fountain, cascading skies, views of the moon and the sunrise. Sparking stars, wind whistling through the trees. We took a visit to a local winery, ate at some local food spots, spent some time walking and reading. At night we had movies and full WIFI. Totally private, and I can't wait to visit again!!!!! Thank you Lois!!!!
